alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Marion, Muscogee and Chattahoochee Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Flat Rock to Fort Moore, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Cusseta, Fort Moore, North Fort Moore, Brantley, Vista Terrace, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Oakland, Manta, Zellobee, Eelbeck/West Fort Moore, Benning Hills, Avondale, Benning Park, Saint Marys Hills, Edgewood, Flat Rock, Highland Park, Christopher, and Sand Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for west central Georgia.
